result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Jacob Schroeder

records.addlTxt: filed by ADA Smestad. arc     e: Atty Schmidt
Request for release/modification/change in sentence. Request bond modification, filed by DE. olg    9/26/2022 Per RMW, Denied. olg

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by PD's office, appointing Atty Schmidt. bph
Filed by DA Office Selena P. arc

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

12:47 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood  in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Jeremy Jacob Schroeder appeared by video, in custody. Includes 22CM567 and 22FO485. DE updates address. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. NG. Reserve on pre-plea rights. DE states he has a PD appointment on other cases. DE to contact PD to see if he qualifies in this matter. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets PSC, but may be rescheduled because DE is set for JT in Branch 3.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
